conclusion: State A: p = 3 × 10⁵ Pa, V = 1 × 10⁻³ m³
State C: p = 1 × 10⁵ Pa, V = 4 × 10⁻³ m³
Temperature at state A is Tₐ = −73 °C = 200 K.

premise: Use the ideal-gas equation n = pV/RT at A.
conclusion: Amount of gas (number of moles) n = (3.0 × 10⁵ Pa)(1.0 × 10⁻³ m³) / (8.31 J mol⁻¹ K⁻¹ · 200 K) ≈ 1.8 × 10⁻¹ mol
Internal energy change from A to C is ΔU = +200 J.
cᵥ for a mono-atomic ideal gas is (3/2)R.

premise: For an ideal gas, ΔU = n cᵥ ΔT.
conclusion: Solve ΔT = ΔU / (n cᵥ) = 200 J / (0.18 mol · (3/2) · 8.31 J mol⁻¹ K⁻¹) ≈ 90 K

premise: Add ΔT to Tₐ to obtain T𝒞.
Using the ideal gas law equation PₐVₐ/Tₐ = P𝒞V𝒞/T𝒞.
conclusion: Solving for T𝒞 gives T𝒞 = 267 K.
